display_asset.caption: Howard Stern announced his new deal with SiriusXM on his radio show.

summaries.body: Howard Stern announced that he was extending his deal with SiriusXM, the satellite radio company, for five more years.

display_asset.caption: Salinas police combed through a house in Salinas on Monday night.

summaries.body: Police officers in Northern California who were investigating a case of torture and abuse of a child this week found the bodies of two children inside a storage unit.

display_asset.caption: Researchers use the rocky terrain on a volcano in Hawaii to simulate life on Mars.

summaries.body: For researchers simulating life on Mars by spending a year living near a Hawaiian volcano, daily life involves re-hydrated food, mock spacesuits and very slow Internet.

display_asset.caption: The remodeled Century Aurora theater, formerly the Century 16, on the day it reopened in Aurora, Colo., in 2013.
display_asset.credit: Matthew Staver for The New York Times

summaries.body: Despite increasing public anxiety about mass shootings in movie theaters, the industry has been reluctant to impose additional security measures.

display_asset.caption: The Giants’ Odell Beckham Jr. dragged his toes while securing a 6-yard touchdown catch in the third quarter against Miami.

summaries.body: Odell Beckham Jr. caught two touchdown passes to help the Giants beat the Miami Dolphins, 31-24, on Monday night. The Giants are in a three-way tie atop the N.F.C. East.
The New York Police Department said on Monday that it was cracking down on drivers near senior centers, the same day a 62-year-old woman was fatally struck by a city bus in Brooklyn.
Tim Peake will become the first British astronaut to visit the International Space Station, blasting off on Tuesday morning. Follow the events live.
An Associated Press investigation found that shrimp sold by businesses like Whole Foods, Walmart and Red Lobster is peeled using slave labor in Thailand.

display_asset.caption: Puerto Ricans watched a televised speech by Gov. Alejandro García Padilla on Monday in which he announced that he would not run for re-election.

summaries.body: Alejandro García Padilla, the embattled governor of Puerto Rico, says he will not run for a second term next year.
Susannah Mushatt Jones, a Brooklyn resident, has been the oldest living person in the world since June. She eats four strips of bacon every morning.
Bill Kennedy, a veteran N.B.A. referee, announced he is gay, days after Rajon Rondo of the Sacramento Kings was suspended for using antigay slurs at him during a game.

display_asset.caption: The Las Vegas Review-Journal, where only the most senior executives know the owner’s identity.
display_asset.credit: Ronda Churchill for The New York Times

summaries.body: Journalists at The Las Vegas Review-Journal are complaining about the lack of transparency of the newspaper’s new mystery owner.

display_asset.caption: A streamlined dinner-party centerpiece that is just as delectable as more authentic versions, but faster, easier and a bit lighter.

sectionFrontImages.credit: Andrew Scrivani for The New York Times

display_asset.title: Timpano

summaries.body: Here's a guide to making a streamlined version of timpano, a baked Italian dish that can serve as a delectable dinner-party centerpiece.

display_asset.caption: If DeAngelo Williams (34) and the Steelers win their last three games, they're in the playoffs.

summaries.body: If the N.F.L. season ended today, the Steelers would be out of the playoffs. But The Upshot thinks the Steelers are actually in much better shape than people think.

display_asset.caption: Adele's "25" was No. 1 on the Billboard album chart for a third week, selling 695,000 copies.

summaries.body: Adele’s “25” continued to hold the No. 1 spot on Billboard’s album chart for a third straight week, easily beating new releases by Coldplay, G-Eazy and Rick Ross.

display_asset.caption: The image of the truck was widely circulated on Twitter and published in news reports since 2014.

summaries.body: A Texas plumber who sold his work truck was shocked to learn it was being used by Islamist fighters on the front lines in Syria. Then the threats started.
Amid several reports of hoverboards catching fire, the Consumer Product Safety Commission is investigating, and retailers are removing the toys from their websites.

A review of an unpublished U.S. military investigation sheds light on Washington's reluctance to crack down on Iraq's Shiite militias for human rights abuses, and draws parallels to the current U.S. strategy to fight ISIS.

display_asset.caption: John Williams has now composed seven “Star Wars” soundtracks.

summaries.body: “Star Wars” fans will get to listen to the latest work of the composer John Williams, who did the soundtrack to “The Force Awakens,” when the film has its premiere.

display_asset.credit: Japan Sport Council/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: Design proposals for Tokyo’s Olympic stadium have been released, and the winner will be announced this month. The city was chosen to host the 2020 Games.

display_asset.caption: Journalists watching a video in 2013 of Gu Kailai, who had been convicted of murdering a business associate. Her husband was the ousted Politburo Standing Committee member Bo Xilai.

summaries.body: A Beijing court said the suspended death sentence given to the wife of one of China’s most prominent politicians should be commuted to life in prison, state-run media reported.
The police and the F.B.I. have opened a hate crimes investigation after two mosques in Southern California were vandalized over the weekend.
In a review of an album by the band Coldplay, a critic considers the merits of kindness, and whether some music deserves to be approached in a more cutting manner.

display_asset.caption: Supporters of the human rights lawyer Pu Zhiqiang demonstrating near the Second Intermediate People’s Court of Beijing on Monday.

summaries.body: Supporters of the Chinese human rights lawyer Pu Zhiqiang rallied outside a Beijing courthouse on Monday as Mr. Pu went on trial over charges of "provoking trouble."
Thousands of residents have been evacuated as Typhoon Melor slammed into eastern Philippines on Monday. Classes and flights have been suspended.

display_asset.credit: Bryan Derballa for The New York Times

summaries.body: For his next book, Marlon James, the author of “A Brief History of Seven Killings,” pledges to deliver a fantasy novel that he describes as “an African ‘Game of Thrones.'”

display_asset.caption: The fate of WHUT, the public television station owned by Howard University, rests with Dr. Wayne A.I. Frederick, the historically black institution’s president, and its board.

summaries.body: Howard University may be selling its rights to a broadcasting spectrum. The sale could spell the end of WHUT, the only black-owned public television station in the United States.
A nurse with tuberculosis may have exposed more than 1,000 people, including 350 infants, to the disease in the maternity ward of a hospital in San Jose, Calif.

display_asset.caption: Italy’s Air Force released to an Italian magazine, L’Espresso, footage obtained by drones pinpointing Islamic State targets in Iraq.

summaries.body: The Italian Air Force released aerial surveillance video that shows suspected Islamic State militants moving around Iraq in enough detail to distinguish children from adults.
Janis Joplin’s famous Porsche sold for $1.7 million, becoming the most expensive Porsche 356 ever sold at auction. The singer bought it used in 1968 for $3,500.
